sentences.en: He felt extremely frustrated when things went against him.
sentences.cn: 形势对他不利时,他感到非常失望.

sentences.en: He gets frustrated when people don’t understand what he’s trying to say.
sentences.cn: 人们不懂他在说什么时，他就会很懊丧。

sentences.en: He often appeared angry and frustrated by the intransigence of both sides.
sentences.cn: 他似乎常常为双方各不相让而生气沮丧。

sentences.en: He was frustrated by deep poverty.
He was frustrated by his inability to wave down a taxi.
sentences.cn: 连一辆出租车都打不到，他很沮丧。

sentences.en: He was frustrated by his poverty.
It's very easy to get frustrated in this job.
sentences.cn: 这个工作很容易令人懊恼。

sentences.en: Journalists are frustrated by his apparent greyness.
sentences.cn: 他毫无个人魅力可言，这让记者们很失望。

sentences.en: The bad weather frustrated all our hopes of going out.
sentences.cn: 恶劣的天气破坏了我们出行的愿望.

sentences.en: The government has deliberately frustrated his efforts to gain work permits for his foreign staff.
sentences.cn: 政府蓄意挫败了他为其外国员工取得工作许可证的努力。

sentences.en: The police frustrated the bandit's attempt to rob the bank.
sentences.cn: 警方挫败了匪徒抢劫银行的企图.

sentences.en: The police frustrated the bandits'attempt to rob the bank.
sentences.cn: 警察挫败了匪徒抢劫银行的企图.

sentences.en: The team's efforts to score were frustrated by the opposing goalkeeper.
sentences.cn: 该队想要进球的努力被对方的守门员挫败了.

sentences.en: The young artist was often frustrated in his ambition to paint.
sentences.cn: 这位年轻艺术家的绘画抱负时常遭到挫折.

sentences.en: When things go wrong, all of us naturally feel disappointed and frustrated.
sentences.cn: 出问题时，我们大家自然都感到失望和沮丧。

trans.tran_en: someone who wants to develop a particular skill but has not been able to do this

trans.tran_cn: 使不成功( frustrate的过去式和过去分词 )，挫败，使受挫折，令人沮丧
trans.tran_en: If someone or something frustrates a plan or attempt to do something, they prevent it from succeeding
